animation

public java.lang.Thread animation
Single thread to control blackboard display and sleep to slow drawing.

Constructor Detail

Teacher

public Teacher(blackboard.Blackboard bb)
Constructor for Teacher. This method first gets the dimensions of the blackboard resource. It plans where to position various elements for teaching and interaction. It initializes various teaching objects (buttons etc.).

Parameters:
bb - Handle to blackboard instance.
numberDigits - Maximum number of digits in numbers to be added.
Method Detail

changeMode

public void changeMode(int mode)
This method changes the mode of teaching (demo, automatic, guided, test). It sets the mode variable and restarts the teaching by setting restart flag.

Parameters:
mode - New phase of teaching.

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Method to perform actions. Handles repeat, step, automatic and done actions. All actions reset flags and return. further processing is controlled by the flags.. The repeat action restarts teaching in the same mode (with a new problem). The step action sets the step mode and continues teaching. The automatic action resets the step mode and continues teaching. The done action resets accept input mode and continues to process unser input.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
e - Action event.

reset

public void reset()
Method to reset teacher. Restarts teaching from beginning.

start

public void start()
Method to start teaching.

stop

public void stop()
Method to pause teaching.

run

public void run()
Method to run single animation Thread. This method has an unending loop. In the loop: If restart flag is set, the problem is solved followed by a delay till repeat or any other user action

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

show

public void show()
This method displays the header details on the blackboard(perform mode and play mode).
  • The method first calls parsetitle() and parseinstruction() to obtain the required strings to be displayed on blackboard
  • On clicking the next button, blackboard is switched to next page.

parseinstruction

public java.lang.String[] parseinstruction(java.lang.String s,
                                           int len)
Breaks the instructions for the experiment into strings such that each string is to be displayed on separate line

Parameters:
s - string to be split
len - characters per line to be displayed on blackboard
Returns:
